medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute diffuse abdominal pain radiating to the back.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with 12 hours of acute abdominal pain, with similar but less intense episodes over the past 4 months. Pain is associated with emesis (non-bilious non-bloody), choluria, subjective fevers, and diaphoresis. She denies acholia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity, non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), hiatal hernia; prior endoscopic ultrasound (EUS) showing common bile duct (CBD) dilation (6.7 mm).
